mapper.insert: insert into mr_nodes_schedule( node_id, computer_name, ip_address, heart_beat_date, process_number, job_json, create_user_id, update_user_id, create_time, update_time, state, iscancel, remark ) values ( #{nodeId}, #{computerName}, #{ipAddress}, #{heartBeatDate}, #{processNumber}, #{jobJson}, #{createUserId}, #{updateUserId}, #{createTime}, #{updateTime}, #{state}, #{iscancel}, #{remark} )
mapper.update: update mr_nodes_schedule set node_id = #{mrNodesSchedule.nodeId}, computer_name = #{mrNodesSchedule.computerName}, ip_address = #{mrNodesSchedule.ipAddress}, heart_beat_date = #{mrNodesSchedule.heartBeatDate}, process_number = #{mrNodesSchedule.processNumber}, job_json = #{mrNodesSchedule.jobJson}, create_user_id = #{mrNodesSchedule.createUserId}, update_user_id = #{mrNodesSchedule.updateUserId}, create_time = #{mrNodesSchedule.createTime}, update_time = #{mrNodesSchedule.updateTime}, state = #{mrNodesSchedule.state}, iscancel = #{mrNodesSchedule.iscancel}, remark = #{mrNodesSchedule.remark} where id = #{id}
mapper.select: select id, node_id AS nodeId, computer_name AS computerName, ip_address AS ipAddress, heart_beat_date AS heartBeatDate, process_number AS processNumber, job_json AS jobJson, create_user_id AS createUserId, update_user_id AS updateUserId, create_time AS createTime, update_time AS updateTime, state, iscancel, remark from mr_nodes_schedule where id = #{id}

select count(id) from mr_nodes_schedule
iscancel = 0
and ip_address LIKE CONCAT('%', #{ipAddress}, '%')
and computer_name LIKE CONCAT('%', #{computerName}, '%')

select id, node_id AS nodeId, computer_name AS computerName, ip_address AS ipAddress, heart_beat_date AS heartBeatDate, process_number AS processNumber, job_json AS jobJson from mr_nodes_schedule
iscancel = 0
and ip_address LIKE CONCAT('%', #{ipAddress}, '%')
and computer_name LIKE CONCAT('%', #{computerName}, '%')
limit #{page.offset},#{page.pageSize}

update_user_id = #{mrNodesSchedule.updateUserId,jdbcType=BIGINT},
